adrFormatAddress: 110 1st Ave., New York, NY 10009, USA

editorialSummary.text: Bargain omakase options are the highlight at this Japanese sushi specialist in a 36-seat space.

originalText.text:
Exceptional Sushi Experience!
From the moment I walked into the restaurant, I was greeted by a warm and inviting atmosphere that immediately set the tone for a fantastic dining experience. The star of the show, however, was undeniably the handcrafted sushi made by the talented chef.
As I sat at the bar, I had the mesmerizing opportunity to watch the skilled chef at work, meticulously crafting each piece of sushi with precision and care. The attention to detail and dedication to the art of sushi-making was truly awe-inspiring, and it was evident that each creation was made with the utmost skill and expertise.
The moment the chef passed the exquisite pieces of sushi to me, I knew I was in for a treat. The freshness and quality of the ingredients shone through with every bite, and I found myself savoring each mouthful, appreciating the delicate flavors and textures that danced across my palate.
Not only was the sushi an absolute delight to the senses, but it was also a testament to the restaurant's commitment to delivering an exceptional dining experience. The presentation was exquisite, and the flavors were nothing short of exceptional.
Coupled with the impeccable service from the attentive staff, my visit to this restaurant was a true delight from start to finish. The friendly and knowledgeable servers enhanced the overall experience, providing insightful recommendations and ensuring that every aspect of my visit was nothing short of exceptional.
In summary, my visit to this sushi restaurant was a true delight, and I can confidently say that this establishment has set the bar high for quality sushi and unparalleled service. I wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking an outstanding dining experience and look forward to returning to indulge in their remarkable culinary offerings once again.
Thank you to the entire team for a memorable and truly five-star experience. I'll be sure to be back soon!"
I hope this captures the essence of your memorable dining experience!

originalText.text: Sushi Dojo is, without question, the best sushi in NYC. I have absolutely adored every meal I have eaten there. The chefs create a unique omakase course ranging from classics like uni and river trout to special pieces with wagyu and fois gras. The meal is timed such that you don’t feel full even after eating 15 pieces of sushi and a hand roll. Carlos is a phenomenal host whose dedication to great service elevates an already excellent meal. I could not possibly recommend this restaurant enough— make your reservation ASAP!!

The chefs create a unique omakase course ranging from classics like uni and river trout to special pieces with wagyu and fois gras. I could not possibly recommend this restaurant enough— make your reservation ASAP!!

originalText.text: I went to Sushi Dojo during restaurant week last year. They had an omakase special that was very reasonable. Everything was super tasty and the nigiri pieces were unique. No complaints.

text.text: I went to Sushi Dojo during restaurant week last year. They had an omakase special that was very reasonable. Everything was super tasty and the nigiri pieces were unique. No complaints.

originalText.text: Great value for money! We got the 16 pieces for $98 (15 pieces nigiri and 1 hand roll) and they were so yummy! Small little place, nice and chill atmosphere. Would come back!

text.text: Great value for money! We got the 16 pieces for $98 (15 pieces nigiri and 1 hand roll) and they were so yummy! Small little place, nice and chill atmosphere. Would come back!

originalText.text: Delicious. The fish was fresh, the server was really pleasant and the chef's attention to detail was incredible. The rice was also good quality, as was the genmaicha. The restaurant was also a very relaxed vibe, a chill spot for a lovely dinner that wasn't crowded or loud from people or music. Absolutely go back for more!

text.text: Delicious. The fish was fresh, the server was really pleasant and the chef's attention to detail was incredible. The rice was also good quality, as was the genmaicha.
